intro: Chrysoma, commonly known as the golden bush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in various habitats including grasslands and rocky areas. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in dense clusters. Chrysoma species are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. They also serve as a food source for certain insects and contribute to local biodiversity.
